alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Ada, southeastern Canyon and northwestern Owyhee Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorms with a strong outflow boundary with damaging winds along a line extending from near Black Warrior Mountain to 6 miles northeast of Silver City to near Oreana. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Silver City and Delamar Mine around 840 PM MDT. Reynolds and Murphy around 900 PM MDT. Melba, Guffey, Walters Ferry and Succor Creek Reservoir around 910 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley
